intro: Andropogon semiberbis var. humilis, commonly known as the dwarf panicgrass, is a grass species native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing perennial with slender,丛生 stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important component of native wetland ecosystems.
